title: Ohms law - resistance of X and Y from I-V graph

content.question: The graph shows current as a function of potential difference for two resistors, Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. If <math alttext="R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> is the resistance of Resistor <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, what is the resistance of Resistor <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>
<math alttext="one half R sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
